key.name: author-name
key.summary: Preferred author's name for Inform 7 projects
key.description: The name you prefer to use for your new Inform 7 projects. If this field is left blank, then your long username is used instead. Note that you can always change the name you are writing under after you have created the project.

key.name: spell-check-default
key.summary: Spell check the Source
key.description: Default setting for spell checking when opening a new window.

key.name: use-interpreter
key.summary: Use the Git interpreter for Glulx story files
key.description: This setting determines the interpreter to use in the Game tab for Glulx story files: Git or Glulxe. Previous versions of Inform 7 used Glulxe, which is still the default, but in the future Git may become standard.

key.name: clean-build-files
key.summary: Clean build files from projects before closing
key.description: Build files are files that are generated while turning your story into a game file. Selecting this option will ensure that they are deleted when you close or save a project. These files can grow quite large (many times the size of your source code), so deleting them is a good idea if you are planning to send a project to someone else.

key.name: clean-index-files
key.summary: Clean index files from projects before closing
key.description: Selecting this option will cause Inform to additionally clean out the project's various index files. These are generated by the Inform 7 compiler and can be safely deleted, though they may be useful the next time you open the project.

key.name: debug-log-visible
key.summary: Show debugging log and Inform 6 intermediate code
key.description: This option places two extra tabs in the Errors panel, containing a debugging log and the Inform 6 intermediate code. It is intended only for advanced users of Inform 7. It is most useful to people involved with maintaining the compiler, although the Inform 6 intermediate code may be of interest to especially advanced extension authors.

key.name: toolbar-default
key.summary: Show the toolbar
key.description: Default setting for showing the toolbar when opening a new window.

key.name: statusbar-default
key.summary: Show the status bar
key.description: Default setting for showing the status bar when opening a new window.

key.name: notepad-default
key.summary: Show the notepad
key.description: Default setting for showing the notepad when opening a new window.

key.name: elastic-tabs-default
key.summary: Use elastic tabstops
key.description: Default setting for using elastic tabstops when opening a new window.

key.name: font-set
key.summary: Font set to use in the Source panel
key.description: Font set to use in the Source panel. Allowed values are "Standard", "Monospace", and "Custom". The first two look for the default proportional and monospace fonts from your desktop theme, respectively, and the latter uses the custom font you select yourself (see custom-font).

key.name: custom-font
key.summary: Custom font to use in the Source panel
key.description: Font to use in the Source panel if font-set (q.v.) is set to "Custom".

key.name: font-size
key.summary: Font size to use in the application
key.description: Font size to use in the application. Allowed values are "Standard", "Medium", "Large", and "Huge". These correspond to multipliers of 1.0, 1.2, 1.4, and 1.8, respectively.

key.name: style-scheme
key.summary: Style scheme to use in the application
key.description: Name of the style scheme to use in the application. The style scheme defines the colors and styles of all of the different highlighting possibilities of the Natural Inform language.

key.name: tab-width
key.summary: Tab width to use in the Source panel
key.description: Tab width, in spaces, to use in the Source panel. A value of 0 means use the default tab width.

key.name: elastic-tab-padding
key.summary: Number of pixels of padding between elastic tabstops
key.description: If elastic tabstops are turned on, there will be this many pixels of padding inserted between the tabstops.

key.name: syntax-highlighting
key.summary: Use syntax highlighting in the Source panel
key.description: Syntax highlighting will automatically color and style your source code to indicate what different parts do. If you have a slow computer, you may see a performance benefit by turning this off.

key.name: auto-indent
key.summary: Use auto-indenting in the Source panel
key.description: If this option is selected, Inform will track the number of tabs at the beginning of the last line and automatically indent the next line accordingly when you insert a new line by pressing return.

key.name: intelligence
key.summary: Use intelligent symbol following in the Source panel
key.description: Inform can keep track of important items in your source files as you type. Enabling this option will allow it to automatically track sections in Natural Inform files.

key.name: intelligent-headings
key.summary: Use intelligent headings display
key.description: If this option is checked, the contents tab will show a real-time display of the sections in your source file. If it is unchecked, it will display the last index calculated by the Natural Inform compiler, i.e. the state of the index at the last time you compiled or ran the story.

key.name: auto-number-sections
key.summary: Auto-number sections as you type
key.description: If you check this option, Inform will automatically renumber sections when you insert a new one. It will also automatically insert a section number as you type: if you type "Part ", Inform will insert "2 - " and renumber the previous Part 2 to Part 3 and so on.

key.name: app-window-width
key.summary: Default width of application window
key.description: Width, in pixels, for newly-created application windows.

key.name: app-window-height
key.summary: Default height of application window
key.description: Height, in pixels, for newly-created application windows.

key.name: slider-position
key.summary: Position of divider between the two pages
key.description: Position of the divider between the two halves of the application window, in pixels, for newly-created application windows.

key.name: ext-window-width
key.summary: Default width of extension window
key.description: Width, in pixels, for newly-created extension windows.

key.name: ext-window-height
key.summary: Default height of extension window
key.description: Height, in pixels, for newly-created extension windows.

key.name: notepad-pos-x
key.summary: Default horizontal position of notepad window
key.description: Horizontal position, in pixels, at which the notepad window will be placed when it is shown.

key.name: notepad-pos-y
key.summary: Default vertical position of notepad window
key.description: Vertical position, in pixels, at which the notepad window will be placed when it is shown.

key.name: notepad-width
key.summary: Default width of notepad window
key.description: Width, in pixels, of the notepad window.

key.name: notepad-height
key.summary: Default height of notepad window
key.description: Height, in pixels, of the notepad window.

key.name: horizontal-spacing
key.summary: Horizontal spacing between Skein branches
key.description: Approximate horizontal spacing, in pixels, between branches in the Skein tab. Allowed values: 0-100.

key.name: vertical-spacing
key.summary: Vertical spacing between Skein branches
key.description: Approximate vertical spacing, in pixels, between branches in the Skein tab. Allowed values: 0-200.
